Package pieces

Class Board

java.lang.Object
pieces.Board
public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
The Board class hosts all the pieces and Nodes where the game is played
Author:
Eric Martz, Minh Huynh

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes 
    Modifier and Type Class Description
    class  Board.Node
    Nodes which represent spots on the board and can hold Pieces

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board()
      Initializes all Nodes with appropriate pieces for start of game

  • Method Details

    • blackWhite

      public void blackWhite​(Board.Node empty)
      Creates the checkered pattern on the board
      Parameters:
      empty - Empty Node to display either a black or white space

    • stringNode

      public static Board.Node stringNode​(java.lang.String node, Board.Node head)
      Searches Nodes for matching Node from String input
      Parameters:
      node - String value to find
      head - Starting node to search from
      Returns:
      Node matching String node

    • moveCheck

      public boolean moveCheck​(Board.Node start, Board.Node end)
      Checks if a move is valid according to piece's movement and if it causes a check
      Parameters:
      start - Node to be moved from
      end - Node to be moved to
      Returns:
      True if move is valid

    • castle

      public boolean castle​(Board.Node start, Board.Node end)
      Determines castling validity between pieces
      Parameters:
      start - Node to start from
      end - Node to move to
      Returns:
      True if castle move is valid

    • move

      public void move​(Board.Node start, Board.Node end)
      Moves node on the board
      Parameters:
      start - Node to be moved from
      end - Node to be moved to

    • kingMove

      public void kingMove​(Board.Node king, Board.Node end)
      Move for king movement for castling
      Parameters:
      king - Node which contains king piece
      end - Node to move king into

    • rookMove

      public void rookMove​(Board.Node rook, Board.Node end)
      Move for rook movement for castling
      Parameters:
      rook - Node which contains rook piece
      end - Node to move rook into

    • printBoard

      public void printBoard​(Board.Node head)
      Prints text in all nodes in board
      Parameters:
      head - First node in board

    • printOccupied

      public void printOccupied​(Board.Node head)
      Prints is occupied in all nodes in board (for testing)
      Parameters:
      head - First node in board

    • getKing

      public Board.Node getKing​(java.lang.String color)
      Returns the node which contains a king piece of the specified color
      Parameters:
      color - Color of the king piece
      Returns:
      Node which contains king of such color

    • getNodeXY

      public Board.Node getNodeXY​(int x, int y)
      Retrieves the Node according to the specified X Y coordinates
      Parameters:
      x - X Coordinate
      y - Y Coordinate
      Returns:
      Node that matches X Y coordinate, No match returns a NullNode

    • getPieceXY

      public Piece getPieceXY​(int x, int y)
      Retrieves the Piece according to the specified X Y coordinates
      Parameters:
      x - X Coordinate
      y - Y Coordinate
      Returns:
      Piece that matches X Y coordinate, No match returns null

    • testCheck

      public boolean testCheck​(Board.Node start, Board.Node end)
      Tests if a given move will cause the king to go into check
      Parameters:
      start - Node to be moved from
      end - Node to be moved to
      Returns:
      True if move will cause a check

    • findCheck

      public Board.Node findCheck​(java.lang.String color)
      Determines if the player's king is in check
      Parameters:
      color - Color of the player
      Returns:
      Node which is causing the king to go into check, returns null if there is no check

    • resetEnPassant

      public void resetEnPassant​(java.lang.String color)
      Resets En passant opportunities
      Parameters:
      color - Color of player

    • isAcrossAttacker

      public boolean isAcrossAttacker​(Board.Node node, java.lang.String color)
      Checks if Node contains piece of opposite color that can attack vertically or hhorizontally
      Parameters:
      node - Node in question
      color - Color of player
      Returns:
      True if Node contains such piece

    • getLineOfAttack

      public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getLineOfAttack​(Board.Node king, Board.Node attack)
      Finds list of points between king and Node
      Parameters:
      king - Node that contains King
      attack - Node that is causing King to be in check
      Returns:
      List of points between

    • getFirstAcross

      public Board.Node getFirstAcross​(Board.Node king)
      Finds attacking Node vertically or horizontally that is in range of king
      Parameters:
      king - Node that contains King to check from
      Returns:
      returns Node that is attacking king, returns null if none is found

    • getFirstDiag

      public Board.Node getFirstDiag​(Board.Node king)
      Finds attacking Node diagonally that is in range of king
      Parameters:
      king - Node that contains King to check from
      Returns:
      returns Node that is attacking king, returns null if none is found

    • isCheckMate

      public boolean isCheckMate​(java.lang.String color)
      Determines if the player is in checkmate
      Parameters:
      color - Color of player
      Returns:
      True if player is in checkmate

    • isStalemate

      public boolean isStalemate​(java.lang.String color)
      Determines if the player is in stalemate
      Parameters:
      color - Color of player
      Returns:
      True if player is in stalemate

      public void testingFunction()
      Testing function to customize board for specific scenarios
